page.title: 01Introduction.
page.content: Block 02480063 is seven miles North of Plymouth and at present is a sparsely populated area, on the edge of the Dartmoor National Park. The area itself is of level farming land with gentle hills with some small valleys. It provides a good exanple of rural life with all its advantages and disadvantages. The main A386 passing through the block links Plymouth to Tavistock with minor roads tracks and footpaths completing the links to small farms and dwelling places. Considering the outskirts of the major town are so close to this block it has seemingly failed to effect the appearance of rural life. However there are signs that the urban way of life is slowly but surely creeping into this rural scene.
